summary: This document is a series of email exchanges between FBI Special Agents and a Federal Protective Service agent in September 2019 regarding obtaining access to video footage (CCV) from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) for case investigations. The emails discuss coordination for accessing footage from specific dates related to visitation.

persons.name: Stephen M. Anest
persons.role: Special Agent, Federal Protective Service, U.S. Department of Homeland Security; Task Force Officer, FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Requests access to review video footage from the MCC for specific dates related to case 90C-NY-3154599, and notes he will be on leave but colleagues will handle the request.

events.title: Email Chain Regarding MCC Video Access
events.description: Series of emails between FBI agents and a Federal Protective Service agent coordinating access to Metropolitan Correctional Center video footage for investigations under separate case numbers.

keyFacts: The correspondence involves a request for access to video footage (CCV) from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) for specific visitation dates: 5/31, 6/14, 6/21, 7/5, 7/26, 8/7, and 8/14.
The request is made by Special Agent Stephen M. Anest of the Federal Protective Service (DHS), who is also a Task Force Officer with the FBI New York Field Office, for case 90C-NY-3154599.
Other FBI agents are mentioned but their names are redacted; they are working on a portion of the case under a separate case number 282B-NY-3156749.
The emails indicate coordination issues, with one agent stating they are not part of that case and referring the requester to another contact.
The document shows inter-agency coordination (FBI and DHS/FPS) for investigative access to correctional facility records in 2019.
